title: Awesome List Updates on Mar 27, 2024
_seo_title: Awesome List Updates on Mar 27, 2024 - Track Awesome List

items.title: Awesome Kde
items.content_text:
### Internet & Networking

*   [NeoChat](https://apps.kde.org/neochat/) - Matrix network client for KDE üìå.
*   [Tokodon](https://apps.kde.org/pt-br/tokodon/) - Tokodon is a Mastodon client. It allows you to interact with the Fediverse community üìå.

### Office & Productivity

*   [GhostWriter](https://ghostwriter.kde.org/) - No distraction markdown editor üìå.

### Utilities & Tools

*   [QOwnNotes](https://www.qownnotes.org/) - Note taking app with cloud integration, web and mobile support.

### Development & Programming

*   [Kate](https://kate-editor.org/) - Kate is a Feature-Packed Code Editor with advanced support for LSP, Syntax Highlighting, multi-cursoe and more üìå.

### Plasma desktop / Extensions

*   [Bismuth (‚≠ê2.4k)](https://github.com/Bismuth-Forge/bismuth) - A KDE Plasma extension that lets you tile windows automatically and manage them via keyboard, just like in classical tiling window managers (i3, dwm or XMondad). (**NOTE** for KDE Plasma 6, check Polonium listed below)
*   [Polonium](https://zeroxoneafour.github.io/polonium/) - The successor of Bismuth for KDE Plasma 6.
items.content_html:
Internet & Networking

  • NeoChat - Matrix network client for KDE üìå.
  • Tokodon - Tokodon is a Mastodon client. It allows you to interact with the Fediverse community üìå.

Office & Productivity

  • GhostWriter - No distraction markdown editor üìå.

Utilities & Tools

  • QOwnNotes - Note taking app with cloud integration, web and mobile support.

Development & Programming

  • Kate - Kate is a Feature-Packed Code Editor with advanced support for LSP, Syntax Highlighting, multi-cursoe and more üìå.

Plasma desktop / Extensions

  • Bismuth (‚≠ê2.4k) - A KDE Plasma extension that lets you tile windows automatically and manage them via keyboard, just like in classical tiling window managers (i3, dwm or XMondad). (NOTE for KDE Plasma 6, check Polonium listed below)
  • Polonium - The successor of Bismuth for KDE Plasma 6.

items.title: Awesome Plotters
items.content_text:

*   [Building an interactive plotter art installation](https://lostpixels.io/writings/building-interactive-plotter-art) - Nice writeup (with videos) of an interactive plotter art exhibit at SIGGRAPH 2023.
items.content_html:
Inspiration, Instruction, and Research / Fonts

  • Building an interactive plotter art installation - Nice writeup (with videos) of an interactive plotter art exhibit at SIGGRAPH 2023.

items.title: Awesome Nix
items.content_text:
### Resources / Learning

*   [NixOS Asia Tutorial Series](https://nixos.asia/en/tutorial) - A series of high-level tutorials on using Nix Flakes, NixOS, home-manager, etc.

Resources / Learning

items.content_text:

*   [simplegpt.nvim (‚≠ê28)](https://github.com/you-n-g/simplegpt.nvim) - Provide a simple yet flexible way to construct and send questions to ChatGPT.

items.title: Awesome Vite
items.content_text:
### Templates / Vue 3

*   [vite-plugin-vue-style-bundler (‚≠ê7)](https://github.com/zhangfisher/vite-plugin-vue-style-bundler) - Auto bundle Vue/sfc styles into JavaScript.

### Framework-agnostic Plugins / Transformers

*   [@import-meta-env/unplugin (‚≠ê259)](https://github.com/runtime-env/import-meta-env) - Inject environment variables into the `import.meta.env` object after building the application instead of statically replacing it during production.
items.content_html:
Templates / Vue 3

  • vite-plugin-vue-style-bundler (‚≠ê7) - Auto bundle Vue/sfc styles into JavaScript.

Framework-agnostic Plugins / Transformers

  • @import-meta-env/unplugin (‚≠ê259) - Inject environment variables into the import.meta.env object after building the application instead of statically replacing it during production.

items.title: Awesome Micropython
items.content_text:
### Display / GUI

*   [micropython-touch (‚≠ê48)](https://github.com/peterhinch/micropython-touch) - Derived from nano-gui and supporting the same displays and hosts, this offers touch input. Supports various touch controllers.

### Scheduling / Touch Resistive

*   [Schedule (‚≠ê799)](https://github.com/peterhinch/micropython-async/blob/master/v3/docs/SCHEDULE.md) - A scheduler for asyncio based applications. Schedule events at specified times and dates or with reference to Sun and Moon rise and set.

### Tutorials / SRAM

*   [asyncio (‚≠ê799)](https://github.com/peterhinch/micropython-async/blob/master/v3/docs/TUTORIAL.md) - Write asynchronous code which interfaces to hardware devices.
items.content_html:
Display / GUI

  • micropython-touch (‚≠ê48) - Derived from nano-gui and supporting the same displays and hosts, this offers touch input. Supports various touch controllers.

Scheduling / Touch Resistive

  • Schedule (‚≠ê799) - A scheduler for asyncio based applications. Schedule events at specified times and dates or with reference to Sun and Moon rise and set.

Tutorials / SRAM

  • asyncio (‚≠ê799) - Write asynchronous code which interfaces to hardware devices.

items.title: Awesome Polars
items.content_text:
### Python / Miscellaneous

*   [polars\_ta (‚≠ê177)](https://github.com/wukan1986/polars_ta) - Python package that provides technical indicator operators rewritten in Polars by [@wukan1986](https://github.com/wukan1986).

### Blog posts / Miscellaneous

*   [Anatomy of a Polars Query: A Syntax Comparison of Polars vs SQL](https://towardsdatascience.com/anatomy-of-a-polars-query-a-syntax-comparison-of-polars-vs-sql-a0035ac8a4fa) - A post that compares Polars syntax to SQL by [@bfeif](https://github.com/bfeif).
items.content_html:
Python / Miscellaneous

  • polars_ta (‚≠ê177) - Python package that provides technical indicator operators rewritten in Polars by @wukan1986.

Blog posts / Miscellaneous

  • Anatomy of a Polars Query: A Syntax Comparison of Polars vs SQL - A post that compares Polars syntax to SQL by @bfeif.
